data.name: Ham
data.description:
1.) Brine ham for 1 week.
    NOTE: Use 50% of water to boil the ingredients, pour over ice to make 1 gallon.
2.) Dry in cooler for 1 week.
3.) smoke at 250 degrees for approximately 5-6 hours until internal temp reaches 145 degrees.

data.name: Hollandaise
data.description:
1.) Start a pot of water on the stove.
2.) Add egg yolks + 1 tsp of lemon juice to a bowl. 
3.) Whisk egg yolks over double boiler until they become lightly cooked and silky smooth. 
4.) Slowly put in cold cubes of whole butter and whisk over the double boiler to make an emulsion.
5.) Season with cayenne, salt, and lemon juice to taste
6.) Store in a warm environment in two containers with a lid.

data.name: Mushroom torte
data.description:
Potatoes
1.) Bake the potato until cooked. 2.) scoop into bowl. 3.) Add butter, salt, and white pepper to season. 4.) Smash into big pieces, do not make mashed potatoes.

1.) Line a mini pie tin with potato about 1/2 of the way up.
2.) Add mushrooms, add chevre, add fine herbs, roll out and cover pie tin with pie crust.
4.) Bake till done

data.name: Pastrami
data.description:
1.)Brine pastrami for 1 week.
    NOTE: Use 50% of water to boil the ingredients, pour over ice to make 1 gallon.
2.) dry in cooler for 1 week
3.) smoke at 250 degrees for approximately 5-6 hours until internal temp reaches 185 degrees for 1 hour.

data.name: Pickling Spice
data.description: Used for brines like pastrami or cucumber pickles. Toast all spices in a dry saute pan and cool. Store in a airtight container away from light.
